intro: Androcymbium huntleyi, commonly known as the Huntley's cymbium, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
